pr_title: feat(detectable): Pass blackduck proxy info to gradle inspector (IDET…

timeline.message: feat(detectable): Pass blackduck proxy info to gradle inspector (IDETECT-1802)

timeline.bodyText: We already have a class for storing proxy related information. It's called ProxyInfo
timeline.author: JakeMathews

replies.bodyText: Ya I was going to just use that class but it doesn't have a field for nonProxyHosts.  I assumed that field was important based on its presence in the Java Networking API, but if it's not, then I agree we should just use ProxyInfo.  Or I guess I could talk to Eric about editing integration-rest...
replies.author: crowleySynopsys

timeline.bodyText: What about the other proxy properties? Such as blackduck.proxy.username, blackduck.proxy.password, blackduck.proxy.ntlm.workstation, blackduck.proxy.ntlm.domain
timeline.author: JakeMathews

replies.bodyText:
I would get the ProxyInfo from ConnectionManager if you can. 
  
    
      synopsys-detect/detect-configuration/src/main/java/com/synopsys/integration/detect/configuration/ConnectionManager.java

      in
      adf1481
    
    
    
    

        
          
           public ProxyInfo getBlackDuckProxyInfo() throws DetectUserFriendlyException {
replies.author: JakeMathews

timeline.message: fix(detectable): Removed class GradleInspectorProxyInfo, GradleInspectionOptions now takes a ProxyInfo (IDETECT-1802)

timeline.bodyText: The current workaround for the customer is to add these arguments to the custom gradle build command. Will supplying multiple of the same arguments cause a problem with gradle? If so should we attempt to de-duplicate the argument the way we do the "dependencies" argument.
timeline.author: JakeMathews
